subject: RE: [junit] Experience with jdk1.4 assert keyword
msgSnippet: ... depending on startup flag ( java -enableassertions ...  or java -disableassertions ... : during debugging, something would happen
messageBody:
> public float sqrt(float number) {
> assert number < 0 : "Number can not be negative.";
> }

depending on startup flag ("java -enableassertions ..." or "java
-disableassertions ..." : during debugging, something would happen
(java.lang.AssertionError thrown), but in production code asserts would not
be treated.

more info: http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4/docs/guide/lang/assert.html

IMO more of a debugging feature than unit testing, and certainly NOT a way
to enforce runtime checks.
